title: I'm done with ranked.
body:
http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/116959910/200953113?tab=overview
http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/117030711/200953113?tab=overview
http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/117033584/200953113?tab=overview

These were my three losses for my Bronze to Silver promos. I actually did well in the first two games, I fed a bit in the last game but we had a 1/12 Jayce. I honestly don't understand. I don't want to complain about "Elo Hell", but seriously just look at these losses. Here were my wins:

http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/116958533/200953113?tab=overview
http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/117032067/200953113?tab=overview

It seems I have to do EXTREMELY well to win. I usually have to get a ridiculously high KDA (like the Lux game).
If it's true I need to carry, who should I play (in jungle or mid)?
Thanks.

And no, I'm not toxic.

replies.body:
Hey man,

I thought you were done with ranked but after reading your post it looks like you are actually looking for help and being open to feedback on how to improve (which is awesome by the way!)

So hopefully some of what I say can be helpful. First off let me just say it is extremely easy to find other reasons for your losses, due to the nature of league every player is to some degree at fault for a loss. I've been there before - http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-strategy/Ais2m0qd-my-ranked-journey-the-last-4-days-1-win-10-losses - but in the end its not productive, there is always something you could have done to push the game in your favor.

There are two huge parts to ranked your own MINDSET and your GAMEPLAY (this includes mechanics and knowledge and experience)

I talk a lot about it here - http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-strategy/zVgleF4L-im-loosing-rank-even-more?comment=0000
Pasted below for you

> Welcome to the Ranked climb!
> 
> Its great to see you are open to advice in your journey. I'll talk about two things to try and help you on the Ranked Ladder. Your game play and how to improve and your attitude towards the game.
> 
> I'm going to start with attitude first because I believe this is one of the most important things to get right before you can improve and climb fast. 
> 
> **Attitude**
> When you are playing Ranked focus on your own gameplay, never look to push blame onto others. Unless you are literally Faker then there are probably things you could have done better to put your team in a position to win. Check out this video from Gbay99 - https://youtu.be/5MTO2a7ZFcc
> 
> Always stay positive, if you don't have something nice to say don't say it. If you are negative in your team chat not only will you add fire to the fuel but you could also potentially start your team on a downward spiral to fighting each other in chat instead of playing the game and trying to win. Remember League of Legends is a team game you have to work together as a team to win. #TeamWorkOP - https://youtu.be/ugXC7g3p0JU
> 
> **Gameplay**
> You've only just started on your ranked journey, there is going to be a lot to learn (hell I've played for 4 years and still have lots to learn). Don't get discouraged by losses and make sure you learn something from every death (why did you die? were you out of position? misjudged damage of opponent? etc) and make sure you always continue to learn about the game. There is a lot more to this game than just csing and fighting champions.
> 
> Check out this sick play list from UNSW LoL Society - https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL9RdXhXESRJzgY_SwHB8T-cZxXljWhQvz
> 
> It will teach you a lot about trading in lane, lane control, team fighting, and also how to use a lead.
> 
> Hope this all helps and good luck on the Rift!

Now on to some specific tips for you! It looks like you love to play Shaco, I'm no Shaco expert or challenger player but here are some things I would say about Shaco.

1) He is an early game champion! Shaco has a 56% winrate in games that end by 25 minutes.
2) Shaco is made for snowballing
3) Shaco is a ADC, He is primarily an AD damage dealer (there are ways to play him AP top I believe but I'm no expert at that and it is extremely uncommon)

So one explanation for you feeling like you have to do extremely well to win is because, on Shaco you do. Not only do you have to snowball early on Shaco you have to understand how to leverage that early lead to take objectives and create picks to secure the win.

Once again not a Shaco expert but looking at pro builds it does look like they go for hyper aggressive summoners and build full AD to take advantage of their early snowballs. It looks like they get {{item:1400}}  or {{item:1412}} into {{item:3074}} , {{item:3142}} , {{item:3031}}  [http://probuilds.net/champions/details/Shaco]

Looking at your history it looks like you favour {{item:3932}} , {{item:3146}} , {{item:3124}} and {{item:3153}}. While this on hit attack speed build is definitely viable and powerful for shaco specifically I feel it takes a tad too long to scale up.

My tips for you would be try out building Shaco full AD like the pros Warriors enchant and Hydra provide power earlier than Devourer and guinsoos. Not to mention AD especially Hydra gives you split push potential, which is something Shacos need.

So my main tip for you would be to try out the AD build and maybe find some pro VOD's of them playing Shaco and see how they move around the map.

P.S. Bonus hint - upgrade your trinket, If you're an assassin AD carry like Shaco get the {{item:3364}} deny the enemy team vision make sure whenever they farm a wave a lone mid to late game you can pop out of nowhere and assassinate their mid or marksmen.

GL man and always here to help

Thank you so much Maraudaur for your reply.
I have recently been building Shaco with Devourer because I feel it is a better build for S6, since Hydra is so expensive. Looks like I might have to go back to AD Shaco.
Also, I always forget to upgrade my trinket. Thanks for reminding me.

As someone who has been playing a lot of Shaco recently, i will give you a bit of info.

First, here is 2 youtubers that do a lot of shaco stuff, and are both really good with shaco
https://www.youtube.com/user/Shaclone/videos
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCmSfdtegCsyBe8qCnRu-ijw

Pink ward shows you what AP shaco does, and Shaclone is a massive AD shaco player.

As for build, while Hydra is expensive it is still fairly core because it aids in your burst and split pushing at the same time.

Your "I'm massively ahead" item build should look like {{item:1400}} {{item:3074}} {{item:3087}} {{item:3156}} {{item:3047}} {{item:3143}} 

This is basically for if you're ahead, it gives you a crap ton of tank stats (armor boots, Randuin's for armor, and Maw for MR.) while still giving a lot of burst in the build (Shiv/Hydra make bursting really easy.)

The order of the items heavily depends on the situation you are in, if you need more burst early, shiv is an amazing item for that, sustain is the hydra.

Here are you situational items.

{{item:3139}} (MR and QSS active) 
{{item:3142}} (amazing active and nice damage/amr pen)
{{item:3036}} /{{item:3033}} (Armor heavy team)
{{item:3026}} /{{item:3102}} (situational Defensive items)
{{item:3111}} (substitute boots.)

And a start that i love that Shaclone does is take the {{item:1041}}  and a {{item:1006}}  this will replace your pots, and give you an item towards hydra while still giving you that early sustain.

Shiv is shaco is despicable.

I just hate how bot lane usually doesn't listen. Bot is warded, I ping for them to back off because Xin Zhao is coming, they ignore it, bot dies.
When I'm in the area I tell them not to push the wave, they shove the wave as hard as they can, then when I'm in my topside jungle they decide to the let the enemies push and usually complain about no ganks.

Hey mate, believe it or not I was a {{champion:35}} one-trick before my friends convinced me to learn a few more champions.

Maraudaur's advice is awesome - he knows a bit too much for someone who claims to not play Shaco, so I'd keep an eye on him...

Here are my Shaco tips after countless games of playing him up to Diamond:

* You have one of the fastest Level 1s of any jungler. A nice cheese to do is to take one buff and immediately run to the opposite buff and start boxing it. This only really works with red buff - if you get there before them, it's almost a guaranteed first blood. After that, you can run to their other buff and box that. If they die twice without getting any buffs, they'll tilt and probably lose.
* The responsibility is on you to make the most of your gold. Shaco's early-mid game is very weak. Once he finishes Hydra he starts ramping up, but if you don't snowball that early gold ASAP, you'll be forced to farm. Don't fight while you're in your power trench, just focus on being useful as soon as possible.
* You have to play Shaco as if he was Rengar - you're meant to kill people extremely fast and get away. You have some chasing power but more often than not, if you get ganged up on when chasing too far, you'll die.
* You can use Hallucinate to dodge certain abilities if you time it right! It's really OP in 1v1s, so get used to using it as a 'block button'.

A more general tip for assassin play is that at lower levels of play, people tend to tunnel really hard when they see a horde of creeps. I call it red dot syndrome, and it's one of the easiest ways to get free kills. Did you know that you can actually manipulate waves to let them push automatically? Just kill the ranged creeps when the waves clash, and more often than not your lane will push towards theirs slowly. When there are enough of your crees pushing towards their tower, I guarantee you a squishy AD carry or mid laner will come for the farm. That's when you jump them!

Ap shaco top. its called pink ward shaco, it consists of morello, lich, zhonya, a magic pen item, gunblade and boots.

Shaco works best with blue smite, warrior, he should only build infinity edge for crit, and should always have rav hydra, the rest is just full ad items. If he does is job right he shoudl be able to assassinate someone within 1 second with qaaehydra in one motion.

And yes he is early game based when in jungle.
Keep in mind that you have now earned free wins for the next time you do your series thanks to the Promo Helper.
Yay! I finally carried my way out of bronze with 2 consecutive wins with Shaco! I also caried both games.

The games you need to 'carry' to climb are the close ones, not the ones that are a stomp one way or the other (and even though these only come along once every 5 or 10 games, winning them all will have a massive effect on your winrate). There is no way to magically carry when your entire team is feeding like crazy or someones afk, and even a silver or gold level player would lose in that situation, but that doesn't mean they can't win more games than they lose. Similarly, that lux game means nothing, your entire team was doing well, and the entire enemy team was feeding, any bronze player playing that game instead of you would likely have won, even if they'd done poorly in lane. You need to be making the diffence in the close games, the ones where an average bronze player might lose but you can turn around by player better than the average player.
I kind of given up ranked too! I hope riot can add 1 t 2 more division below bronzes so as to make bronze matchup more playable.

shaco is better with warrior, and maybe even runeglaive, over devourer

lee sin really benefits from any type of AD. warrior enchant into tank would be ok, but especially in solo queue, full tank lee sin is undoubtedly less effective

i dont think lux should be a champ that gets seraphs AND roa. right now in general i dont think seraphs is as beneficial since roa gives sooo much mana and ap already. i think lich bane and roa, for guaranteed sufficient mana, are good enough items that give the mana and utility you need as a lux

been reading the replies Maurauder would like some advice myself Ive had a lot of negative feed back from my team mates and not to happy about the results but am in a similar situation truegolddigger.  ive played for 4 years and consider my self accomplished player but seriously this seems to be a common problem wouldnt you agree!

Bro bro, calm down yeah

Now. listen to this story.
If faker comes to play on your account..
Do you reckon he can get out of bronze?

I think the answer is pretty obvious. Ofc he can.

Now what u need to understand is, u need to be a lot better then the elo you are in, to get out of whatever ur at. Its that simple. If u can't get our of that elo, it simply means ur not good enuff. That being said, im not saying faker can win every single game he plays but the probability of him winning is much higher then yours. So that means yes you have to do extremely well to win. Once you get a lot better, you will climb.

> [{quoted}](name=XSirCution,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=cZXHPfrw,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-12-30T06:16:46.702+0000)
> u need to be a lot better then the elo you are in, to get out of whatever ur at. 
That's a lie.

> [{quoted}](name=Truegolddigger,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=cZXHPfrw,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-12-30T06:20:20.866+0000)
>
> That's a lie.

Nah, seems legit to me. If you are a silver player you won't carry out of bronze right away, it will take a while. But if you are a lot better then you'll carry faster.

1st game: Everyone was feeding. Maybe something to do with chasing? And nobody bought blue trinket, Support was a noob.

2nd game: Looks like Lee Sin carried the game. Both supports are part of the 95% of OCE that can't support (no sweeper).

3rd game: Guess who carried, guess who bought a blue trinket.

4th game: Your team played better and you carried. Your team had more cc, usually wins in bronze games.

5th game: You and Tryndamere carried. Madlife wannabe fed (probably was not so helpful to his lane partner, looking at the cs levels).

Lux is a great mid laner for this level, also Akali. If you can play Lee Sin well, stick to him in the jungle. Or just take Volibear :)

Yeah same. Ranked is just not fun. It's full of trolls who intentionally ruin other peoples games. High silver is much worse though so if you do continue with ranked and climb up, be prepared for really frustrating games. Just play normals imo.

Every since I found they made promos 5 rounds. I gave up. Just no. Ranked isn't even worth it. We can still be pro players without a rank. Rank Icons are just like a sticker. They maybe at a high rank, yet they could do common misplays. ANYWAY, we can be pro players in disguise. Those who do have high ranks sometimes just want attention.
